option.description: The cutoff distance for the coulombic (electrostatic) interactions.
The cutoff distance for the Lennard Jones (van der waals) interactions.

The feather distance used to scale down the non-bonded interactions between the feather distance and the cutoff distance. This allows the non-bonded cutoff to be applied gradually, rather than the cutoff applying abruptly at the cutoff distance. Feather distances should typically be 0.5 or 1.0 angstroms less than the corresponding cutoff distances.
